oai_dc:dc.dc:title: On the Farm Diagnostic Procedures for Specific Toxicants
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Meerdink, Gavin
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: diagnostic procedures
toxicants
sampling
diagnostic toxicology
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: If you had a chance to talk to a practitioner and explain the problems in diagnostic toxicology, what would be the subject? And it was pretty unanimous. Everyone said sampling. So at any rate I would like to twist my title just a little bit and talk about more sampling problems or some ideas and bring up a few points. I hate to be so melodramatic about this. It's a slide I had for a talk before .. . a study that we made on sampling
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1984; 179-181
